questions.question: The angle subtended at the centre of the directing circle is calculated by the formula ____.
questions.explanation: The angle subtended = (R/r) × 180° for a rolling circle tracing a hypocycloid or epicycloid.

questions.question: The arch length of a cycloid is how many times the radius of a circle generating the cycloid?
questions.explanation: The arc length of one complete cycloid is approximately 8 times the radius of the generating circle.

questions.question: Gear tooth is a combination of hypocycloid and epicycloid.
questions.explanation: Gear teeth profiles often use hypocycloid for flanks and epicycloid for faces.

questions.question: If the diameter of the directing circle is doubled the diameter of the generating circle then the hypocycloid will become a ______.
questions.explanation: When the directing circle’s diameter is twice the generating circle’s, the hypocycloid becomes a straight line.

questions.question: A circle of 30 mm diameter rolls outside another circle of diameter 150 mm. The angle subtended at the centre of directing circle is _____
Which of the following curve will be generated if a circle of diameter 40 mm rolls on the circumference of another circle of diameter 150 mm and outside it?
questions.explanation: When a circle rolls outside another circle’s circumference, it generates an epicycloid.
